main_text:
Theological Fatalism: Pike’s argument and God’s omniscience || An Aristotelian solution
5.1 An Aristotelian solution

One might object to the conclusion that God believed in 1900 that
Jones would mow his lawn on 1/1/2000, on the grounds that propositions
about future contingents are not true. So if God is omniscient in the
way assumed, he would not hold this belief.
hierarchy_title: Fatalism || Theological Fatalism: Pike’s argument and God’s omniscience || An Aristotelian solution
